Class GameImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • hotciv.standard.GameImpl

    Game

    public class GameImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Game
    Skeleton implementation of HotCiv. This source code is from the book "Flexible, Reliable Software: Using Patterns and Agile Development" published 2010 by CRC Press. Author: Henrik B Christensen Computer Science Department Aarhus University This source code is provided WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY either expressed or implied. You may study, use, modify, and distribute it for non-commercial purposes. For any commercial use, see http://www.baerbak.com/

        public Unit getUnitAt(Position p)

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getAge

        public int getAge()
        Description copied from interface: Game
        return the age of the world. Negative numbers represent a world age BC (-4000 equals 4000 BC) while positive numbers are AD.
        Specified by:
        getAge in interface Game
        Returns:
        world age.

      • moveUnit

        public boolean moveUnit(Position from,
               Position to)
        Description copied from interface: Game
        move a unit from one position to another. If that other position is occupied by an opponent unit, a battle is conducted leading to either victory or defeat. If victorious then the opponent unit is removed from the game and the move conducted. If defeated then the attacking unit is removed from the game. If a successful move results in the unit entering the position of a city then this city becomes owned by the owner of the moving unit. Precondition: both from and to are within the limits of the world. Precondition: there is a unit located at position from.
        Specified by:
        moveUnit in interface Game
        Parameters:
        from - the position that the unit has now
        to - the position the unit should move to
        Returns:
        true if the move is valid (no mountain, move is valid under the rules of the game variant etc.), and false otherwise. If false is returned, the unit stays in the same position and its "move" is intact (it can be moved to another position.)

      • endOfTurn

        public void endOfTurn()
        Description copied from interface: Game
        Tell the game that the current player has finished his/her turn. The next player is then in turn. If all players have had their turns then do end-of-round processing: A) restore all units' move counts B) produce food and production in all cities C) produce units in all cities (if enough production) D) increase population size in all cities (if enough food) E) increment the world age.
        Specified by:
        endOfTurn in interface Game

      • changeWorkForceFocusInCityAt

        public void changeWorkForceFocusInCityAt(Position p,
                                java.lang.String balance)
        Description copied from interface: Game
        change the work force's focus in a city, i.e. what kind of production there will be emphasis on in the city. Precondition: there is a city at location 'p'.
        Specified by:
        changeWorkForceFocusInCityAt in interface Game
        Parameters:
        p - the position of the city whose focus should be changed.
        balance - a string defining the focus of the work force in a city. Valid values are at least GameConstants.productionFocus and GameConstants.foodFocus.

      • changeProductionInCityAt

        public void changeProductionInCityAt(Position p,
                            java.lang.String unitType)
        Description copied from interface: Game
        change the type of unit a city will produce next. Precondition: there is a city at location 'p'.
        Specified by:
        changeProductionInCityAt in interface Game
        Parameters:
        p - the position of the city whose production should be changed.
        unitType - a string defining the type of unit that the city should produce next.

      • performUnitActionAt

        public void performUnitActionAt(Position p)
        Description copied from interface: Game
        perform the action associated with the unit at position p. Example: a settler unit may create a new city at its location. Precondition: there is a unit at location 'p'.
        Specified by:
        performUnitActionAt in interface Game
        Parameters:
        p - the position of a unit that must perform its action. Nothing happens in case the unit has no associated action.
